did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: A pioneer in video art, Vâelez, together with Gary Hill and Bill Viola, was at the forefront of the generation that established video as an art form in the 1970s.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Media materials require at least two weeks advance notice to use in order to allow staff time to have use copies made from the original items.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edin Vâelez Papers and videos. M0933. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Educated at the University of Puerto Rico, where he was influenced by Marshal McLuhan, Vâelez subsequently moved to New York where he studied at Global Village. Vâelez has been credited with the development of "a new transequential language of representation," in which multiple scenes are superimposed and juxtaposed within the frame. In this respect, Vâelez's production notes on his video pieces provide a unique and invaluable resource on how he was able to make these advances using analog formats -- nearly a decade before digital formats made layered imagery a standard practice in video production. In his numerous videos, Vâelez has explored other cultures -- from the Cuna Indians of Panama to the Butoh dancers of Japan -- using his unique video aesthetic and language to explore intercultural dialogue and self-reflexive ethnography. Above all, Vâelez's videos attest to the impossibility of a one-to-one translation across cultural boundaries. (Extracted from notes by Chon Noriega, Dept. of Film and Television, UCLA)

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, scripts, business papers, original artwork, and production stills related to videos. Twenty completed video works, nearly half of which are out of distribution, 51 hours of video documentation including "Behind the Scenes," a 19-hour documentary of the production process for two key works: A MOSQUE IN TIME and MEMORY OF FIRE, and a 32-hour documentary of Japanese Butoh dance, and last, video copies of television interviews with Vâelez for Spanish, Argentinian, and Japanese television.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Butåo.
Cuna Indians.
Modern dance--Japan.
Video art.

scopecontent.p: 30 pages 4 handwritten ideas, notes, many sketches of installations, objects,books storyboards for tapes never shot, original notes for "Memory of Fire" (not named as such), notes on art, ect.

did.unittitle: 2. Meaning of the Interval" edit notes, file 2, 19861986
did.physdesc: 96 manuscript sheets,4 photo contact sheets

scopecontent.p: Sketches and br storyboards explore how to combine different scenes in one frame. Most of the sketches are done in colored marker, the given color used as a code for the type of scene (i.e.:religious, modern,traditional, etc.) includes hand drawn stencils for Japanese words used as key elements, and hand drawn wipe templates. Very complete documentation of the editing process of one of the first videos made using multiple simultaneous layers of images in collage fashion. most pages are dated so one can follow the process of layering. Also, 4 photographic contact sheets that have every major scene used in the editing. This method of visually storing the key frame of every scene will be used by Ev to keep a record of very scenee in every tape from this point on.

did.unittitle: 3. Color photocollage for Meaning of the Interval postcard made in the style of the video, 19871987
4. "Meaning of the Interval" edit notes, file 1, 1985-86
did.physdesc: 34 manuscript sheets see number 2 above for description

did.unittitle: 5. "Dance of Darkness" edit notes, spiral bound notebook, 1988
did.physdesc: 36 pages

scopecontent.p: Mostly manuscript, a few typescrpit logs with detailed annotations at margins. Many sketches and storyboards for multi-layering edit. many pages but not all dated.

did.unittitle: 6. Two architectural renderings of 3 channel video installation: "Naruhodo"
did.physdesc: Drawings are originals (1987?) pencil on vellum, 11" by 16" -Also, four high qualty xeroxes (originals lost) of sketches leading up to final drawings 11" by 16" Installation not yet completed.

did.unittitle: 7. Eight pages, manuscript on grid paper, color coded for final audio mix: Dance of Darkness.

scopecontent.p: Shows every audio layer of final tape individually, 7 audio tracks with descriptions.

did.unittitle: 8. Dance of Darkness, edit notes file, 38 pages 1988-89

scopecontent.p: Includes all translations,transcripts, annotatde. Original ink Drawings for title card in English and French.

did.physdesc: 11 pages,62 cards 2 by 4 with scene descriptions (and written) Handwritten diagrams delineating a multi layered narrative. Precursor to Hypertext, and CD rom.Dot matrix sceond version included which has changes.project not completed
29 pages video logs with notations,one manuscript page with sketches/storyboards

scopecontent.p: For a edit of footage shot in Guatemala while making Meta Mayan to be used in a new video. Video logs are pages that have 12 images from original footage. original scenes printed from video using video printer then fitted on one page and xeroxed.-project not completed. NOTE: whenever I use the term "video log" it refers to these visual, not text, pages. Each page has color coded markings as to how certain parts of images would be used in layers with others.

did.unittitle: 11. Signal to Noise: video logs with notations
did.physdesc: 14 pages 1989,10 original thermal video printouts.

scopecontent.p: For not completed autobiographical video.

did.physdesc: (79 pages)

scopecontent.p: original treatment submitted for funding to ITVS in 1990 subsequent scripts each with amjor changes 1992 through 1993 shows evolution of film very clearly

did.unittitle: 13. Memory of Fire: Fax correspondence between EV and producers of film 93-94
did.physdesc: 24 sheets including original faxes received from producers.

scopecontent.p: This correspondence was 2/3 during production when relationship between EV and producers deteriorated and communication was solely via fax. A number of major issues and problems are discussed.
5 manuscript sheets early multi layer storynoards for film, never realised, as well as illustrated character descriptions, and flying boat sketch, never realised.
9 sheets,set design EV in colab. with designer Mark Stieger 1 by 16 xeroxes, ,with handwritten notations by EV (originals lost) for sets, never realised.

did.physdesc: 9 sheets, character and costume designs EV in colab. with designer Mark Stieger, 8 by 11 xeroxes ( orig. lost) with EV notations. never realised.
9 sheets, Art Dir. plans for actual sets, 11 by 16 xeroxes, orig lost, no notations
14 sheets, 8 by 11 xeroxes of images used as references in original script, copies of engravings and paintings. Notations as to scene no. etc.

scopecontent.p: Scene breakdown script, no notes, 1993 14 pages Lists actors,action, set, props ,etc for every scene in script

Editing notes file, 10 handwritten sheets with notes ,sketches and storyboards; Scribe scene completely annotated script section(3 sheets). Court of the Queen script section (3 sheets) annotated. 5 foot by 2 foot handwritten chart on grid paper showing all music and audio and track assigned (8 audio tracks),color coded and notated.

did.unittitle: 21. A Mosque in Time: Edit file: 1990
did.physdesc: 14 handwritten pages with multi layer sketches, and edit notes. 11 pages of video logs with notation

scopecontent.p: 3 letters to and from the Spanish performance group La Fura Dels Baus about collaborating on a video on Columbus, 1991, as well as literature on the group
Edit notes (7 handwritten pages). video logs with notations 32 pages 1994
Interview transcripts with all dancers, 82 pages
Final selects video logs with notations, and some color coding 43 sheets,2 handwritten note sheets.

did.physdesc: 56 one hour U-Matic Videocassettes.
